page.title: 16OUTSIDE ASKAM AND IRELETH
page.content: This particular information is representative of the other squares in the block. This kilometre square is bounded by an outcrop behind High Mere Beck Farm by Marsh Grange in the north and by the spring on the main road by Tippins Bridge. In the east the square is bounded by Guards Farm. The square has five residences but mainly the square is fell-side land and estuarial plain, heavily hedged, with some slight evidence of hedges being removed to increase field size. As a consequence there is a noted decrease in wild life habitat. Never the less remaining grass land is very rich and favours much varied wildlife. It is also noted that there are six freshwater springs in this particular square and similar numbers in the others. This favours arable land.
